attributes.mlflow.spanInputs:
{"system_prompt": "You are Roadcast's documentation concierge. Blend GitBook product docs with runtime RAG snippets to provide crisp, actionable answers for internal operators. Every reply must be factual, cite numbered references, and clearly separate summaries from implementation steps.", "user_question": "how to login", "snippets": ["[1] Title: Home | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
house
Home
Start here. Learn the product fast, find the right workflows, and get back to ops.
hashtag
Welcome to the BOLT V2 docs
You’re in the right place if you run fleets, field assets, or on‑ground teams.
This space helps you go from “what is BOLT?” to “ship it in production”.
circle-info
These docs are written for operators and product owners first.
If you’re integrating systems, start with the overview.
hashtag
Pick your path
I’m new here
→ get the big picture, then learn the core concepts.
I’m running ops today
→ find workflows, exceptions, and day‑to‑day actions.", "[2] Title: Yard & Warehouse Management | Documentation | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/yard-and-warehouse-management
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
Basic Docs
Yard & Warehouse Management
hashtag
Dock & Trip Flow
Optimizing turn-around time (TAT) is the primary goal of the Yard module.
Trip Purpose:
Every vehicle entering the facility must be assigned a purpose (e.g., Inward Goods, Outbound Dispatch, or Empty movement).
Dock Activity:
Track exactly how long a vehicle stays at a specific dock for loading or unloading.
Approval Matrix:
Custom workflows where gate-in or gate-out events require digital authorization from a supervisor.
Turn-Around Time (TAT) Gauge
circle-info
The TAT Gauge visualizes the average Gate-to-G", "[3] Title: Getting Started | Documentation | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/getting-started
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
Basic Docs
Getting Started
hashtag
Authentication and Security
Access is gated by a multi-layered security protocol:
Credentials:
Unique username and password mapped to your organization.
MFA/OTP Verification:
A secondary security layer requiring a one-time password sent via registered email or SMS.
Instant Session Invalidation:
The system utilizes a "Session Versioning" strategy. If an account is suspended, all active JSON Web Tokens (JWT) are blacklisted instantly, terminating sessions across all browsers and mobile apps.
hashtag
Workspace Selection & Context Switching", "[4] Title: Core Operational Logic & Expected Behaviors | Documentation | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/core-operational-logic-and-expected-behaviors
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
Basic Docs
Core Operational Logic & Expected Behaviors
hashtag
Financial & Billing Scenarios (Case 9.1)
The system manages funds differently based on the organization's billing configuration.
Scenario
Mode
Expected Behavior
Financial Impact
Purchase with 0 local balance
Centralized
Success:
The system automatically identifies the Parent Wallet and deducts funds.
Parent Org is charged.
Purchase with 0 local balance
Decentralized
Failure:
The transaction is blocked instantly.
No charge; user must recharge.
Add-on activation
Either
The system verifies the wallet type before"], "format_instructions": "If a query cannot be answered from the provided snippets, say so explicitly and recommend which doc to read.
Use the format: ## Direct Answer, ## Key Details (bullets), ## References (numbered list).
Always mention the reference number in-line like [1] whenever referencing a fact.
Keep answers under 220 words unless the user asks for exhaustive detail.
Highlight commands or API names with backticks.
Never hallucinate URLs; always reuse the snippet URLs provided.
Follow the template strictly:
## Direct Answer
<2-3 sentence summary>
## Key Details
- Bullet fact with inline [number]
- Another fact
## References
[List every reference as [n] Title — URL]"}
attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
{"answer_markdown": "## Direct Answer
To log in to Roadcast, you need to use your unique username and password associated with your organization. The system also requires multi-factor authentication (MFA) or a one-time password (OTP) sent via your registered email or SMS for added security.

## Key Details
- Access is secured by a multi-layered protocol including credentials and MFA/OTP verification [3].
- If your account is suspended, all active sessions are instantly invalidated using a session versioning strategy [3].
- After authentication, you may need to select your workspace or context to proceed [3].

## References
[3] Getting Started | Documentation | Roadcast Docs — https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/getting-started"}

{"signature": "GitBookAnswerSignature(system_prompt, user_question, snippets, format_instructions -> answer_markdown
    instructions='Formats GitBook search snippets into a markdown answer with references.'

    user_question = Field(annotation=str required=True json_schema_extra={'desc': 'End-user query to answer', '__dspy_field_type': 'input', 'prefix': 'User Question:'})
    snippets = Field(annotation=List[str] required=True json_schema_extra={'desc': 'List of numbered passages generated from GitBook search results', '__dspy_field_type': 'input', 'prefix': 'Snippets:'})
    format_instructions = Field(annotation=str required=True json_schema_extra={'desc': 'Explicit formatting instructions, including headings and reference block template', '__dspy_field_type': 'input', 'prefix': 'Format Instructions:'})
    answer_markdown = Field(annotation=str required=True json_schema_extra={'desc': 'Well-structured markdown answer that cites references in-text and ends with a references list', '__dspy_field_type': 'output', 'prefix': 'Answer Markdown:'})
)", "demos": [], "inputs": {"system_prompt": "You are Roadcast's documentation concierge. Blend GitBook product docs with runtime RAG snippets to provide crisp, actionable answers for internal operators. attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
[{"role": "system", "content": "Your input fields are:
1. `system_prompt` (str): Agent system prompt describing persona and guardrails
2. `user_question` (str): End-user query to answer
3. `snippets` (list[str]): List of numbered passages generated from GitBook search results
4. `format_instructions` (str): Explicit formatting instructions, including headings and reference block template
Your output fields are:
1. `answer_markdown` (str): Well-structured markdown answer that cites references in-text and ends with a references list
All interactions will be structured in the following way, with the appropriate values filled in.

[[ ## system_prompt ## ]]
{system_prompt}

[[ ## user_question ## ]]
{user_question}

[[ ## snippets ## ]]
{snippets}

[[ ## format_instructions ## ]]
{format_instructions}

[[ ## answer_markdown ## ]]
{answer_markdown}

[[ ## completed ## ]]
In adhering to this structure, your objective is: 
        Formats GitBook search snippets into a markdown answer with references."}, {"role": "user", "content": "[[ ## system_prompt ## ]]
You are Roadcast's documentation concierge. Blend GitBook product docs with runtime RAG snippets to provide crisp, actionable answers for internal operators. Every reply must be factual, cite numbered references, and clearly separate summaries from implementation steps.

[[ ## user_question ## ]]
how to login

[[ ## snippets ## ]]
["[1] Title: Home | Roadcast Docs\nURL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs\nExcerpt: copy\nCopy\nchevron-down\nhouse\nHome\nStart here. Learn the product fast, find the right workflows, and get back to ops.\nhashtag\nWelcome to the BOLT V2 docs\nYou’re in the right place if you run fleets, field assets, or on‑ground teams.\nThis space helps you go from “what is BOLT?” to “ship it in production”.\ncircle-info\nThese docs are written for operators and product owners first.\nIf you’re integrating systems, start with the overview.\nhashtag\nPick your path\nI’m new here\n→ get the big picture, then learn the core concepts.\nI’m running ops today\n→ find workflows, exceptions, and day‑to‑day actions.", "[2] Title: Yard & Warehouse Management | Documentation | Roadcast Docs\nURL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/yard-and-warehouse-management\nExcerpt: copy\nCopy\nchevron-down\nBasic Docs\nYard & Warehouse Management\nhashtag\nDock & Trip Flow\nOptimizing turn-around time (TAT) is the primary goal of the Yard module.\nTrip Purpose:\nEvery vehicle entering the facility must be assigned a purpose (e.g., Inward Goods, Outbound Dispatch, or Empty movement).\nDock Activity:\nTrack exactly how long a vehicle stays at a specific dock for loading or unloading.\nApproval Matrix:\nCustom workflows where gate-in or gate-out events require digital authorization from a supervisor.\nTurn-Around Time (TAT) Gauge\ncircle-info\nThe TAT Gauge visualizes the average Gate-to-G", "[3] Title: Getting Started | Documentation | Roadcast Docs\nURL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/getting-started\nExcerpt: copy\nCopy\nchevron-down\nBasic Docs\nGetting Started\nhashtag\nAuthentication and Security\nAccess is gated by a multi-layered security protocol:\nCredentials:\nUnique username and password mapped to your organization.\nMFA/OTP Verification:\nA secondary security layer requiring a one-time password sent via registered email or SMS.\nInstant Session Invalidation:\nThe system utilizes a \"Session Versioning\" strategy. If an account is suspended, all active JSON Web Tokens (JWT) are blacklisted instantly, terminating sessions across all browsers and mobile apps.\nhashtag\nWorkspace Selection & Context Switching", "[4] Title: Core Operational Logic & Expected Behaviors | Documentation | Roadcast Docs\nURL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/core-operational-logic-and-expected-behaviors\nExcerpt: copy\nCopy\nchevron-down\nBasic Docs\nCore Operational Logic & Expected Behaviors\nhashtag\nFinancial & Billing Scenarios (Case 9.1)\nThe system manages funds differently based on the organization's billing configuration.\nScenario\nMode\nExpected Behavior\nFinancial Impact\nPurchase with 0 local balance\nCentralized\nSuccess:\nThe system automatically identifies the Parent Wallet and deducts funds.\nParent Org is charged.\nPurchase with 0 local balance\nDecentralized\nFailure:\nThe transaction is blocked instantly.\nNo charge; user must recharge.\nAdd-on activation\nEither\nThe system verifies the wallet type before"]

[[ ## format_instructions ## ]]
If a query cannot be answered from the provided snippets, say so explicitly and recommend which doc to read.
Use the format: ## Direct Answer, ## Key Details (bullets), ## References (numbered list).
Always mention the reference number in-line like [1] whenever referencing a fact.
Keep answers under 220 words unless the user asks for exhaustive detail.

<2-3 sentence summary>
## Key Details
- Bullet fact with inline [number]
- Another fact
## References
[List every reference as [n] Title — URL]

Respond with the corresponding output fields, starting with the field `[[ ## answer_markdown ## ]]`, and then ending with the marker for `[[ ## completed ## ]]`."}]

attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
["[[ ## answer_markdown ## ]]
## Direct Answer
To log in to Roadcast, you need to use your unique username and password associated with your organization. The system also requires multi-factor authentication (MFA) or a one-time password (OTP) sent via your registered email or SMS for added security.

## Key Details
- Access is secured by a multi-layered protocol including credentials and MFA/OTP verification [3].
- If your account is suspended, all active sessions are instantly invalidated using a session versioning strategy [3].
- After authentication, you may need to select your workspace or context to proceed [3].

## References
[3] Getting Started | Documentation | Roadcast Docs — https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/getting-started

[[ ## completed ## ]]"]

attributes.mlflow.spanInputs:
{"signature": "GitBookAnswerSignature(system_prompt, user_question, snippets, format_instructions -> answer_markdown
    instructions='Formats GitBook search snippets into a markdown answer with references.'
    system_prompt = Field(annotation=str required=True json_schema_extra={'desc': 'Agent system prompt describing persona and guardrails', '__dspy_field_type': 'input', 'prefix': 'System Prompt:'})
    user_question = Field(annotation=str required=True json_schema_extra={'desc': 'End-user query to answer', '__dspy_field_type': 'input', 'prefix': 'User Question:'})
    snippets = Field(annotation=List[str] required=True json_schema_extra={'desc': 'List of numbered passages generated from GitBook search results', '__dspy_field_type': 'input', 'prefix': 'Snippets:'})
    format_instructions = Field(annotation=str required=True json_schema_extra={'desc': 'Explicit formatting instructions, including headings and reference block template', '__dspy_field_type': 'input', 'prefix': 'Format Instructions:'})
    answer_markdown = Field(annotation=str required=True json_schema_extra={'desc': 'Well-structured markdown answer that cites references in-text and ends with a references list', '__dspy_field_type': 'output', 'prefix': 'Answer Markdown:'})
)", "completion": "[[ ## answer_markdown ## ]]
## Direct Answer
To log in to Roadcast, you need to use your unique username and password associated with your organization. The system also requires multi-factor authentication (MFA) or a one-time password (OTP) sent via your registered email or SMS for added security.

## Key Details
- Access is secured by a multi-layered protocol including credentials and MFA/OTP verification [3].
- If your account is suspended, all active sessions are instantly invalidated using a session versioning strategy [3].
- After authentication, you may need to select your workspace or context to proceed [3].

## References
[3] Getting Started | Documentation | Roadcast Docs — https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/getting-started

[[ ## completed ## ]]"}
